intro: Cochranea hebecula, commonly known as the narrow-leaf cochrania, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-arid environments. Cochranea hebecula is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in arid gardens.
